website_summaries.verdict: Easy to apply and has been known to work well for some cat owners; however, not all experienced the same positive results.
pros: Works in as little as 6 hours to kill fleas and ticks
Cat owners praise the applicator tip that makes applying the product easy, even on cats with long, dense fur
cons: Although it can be used on kittens 8 weeks and older, they must weigh at least 1.5 pounds
Some reports of cats experiencing skin reactions after use
May not work on all flea and tick problems

customer_reviews.title: Burned my Kitties Skin!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted this to be effective! And we wanted to give it 5 stars... We care for an aging colony and this is more affordable than most. Our hale and hearty 'test kitty' has a burn and scab on her back where the product was applied! See photos. Please use with caution, or not at all. We're aware she is fair skinned and colored, but she has never had a reaction to Advantage, Parentadine et al. Packing for return.
customer_reviews.author: LadyRobyn

customer_reviews.title: Ticks are gone!
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. My outdoor cat had one to two ticks per day. Since catego - none. Also - no fleas.
customer_reviews.author: S. Altman

customer_reviews.title: Do not use do your reasearch!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews on this product, I applied it on my cats as directed and overnight 2 of them would up with bald spots at the application site. It wasn't from scratching as there is no marks on the skin and it was applied between the shoulders so that it would be difficult to get at. looks like a reaction or a bad batch. I now see others have experienced them same! And try calling their customer service its not possible! Stick to the well known name brands!
customer_reviews.author: Mcjunkin Sales

customer_reviews.title: Fleas are alive and hopping long after proper application ;(
customer_reviews.text: Bummer. The description says kills fleas within 6 hours. Applied exactly as direction says - 1 tube for each of my cats at base of head, parting their hair carefully so it would penetrate the skin. Its been over 24 hours and living fleas are still hanging out around the site of application. Not sure whats going on, since fipronil is supposed to work great for fleas -perhaps it a lower quality chemical that Catego used for this batch, but since fleas are alive and hopping, obviously the product isn't doing what it claims to do.
customer_reviews.author: Moi Bell

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product burned 2 of my cats, this product should be taken off the market , I have always used topical on them with zero effect, can't rate below 1 star or I would
customer_reviews.author: Shelia Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Can burn fair skinned cats!!
customer_reviews.text: I have four cats. After seeing some well-known Foster folks using this on there cats and kittens, I wanted to try it because it was available without a prescription. I applied it to my first blue cat without any incident. The next cat I tried it on was my snowshoe Siamese mix. Didn't seem to be bothering him didn't show any reaction when I put it on, but two days later he formed a really nasty sore and scab at the application site. Now I'm afraid to use it on my other two cats. I guess it's back to prescription medicine for them! It may work but use with caution!
customer_reviews.author: R.Hames

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 cats. This product works! We have used it 3 times now, one application per cat a month. We live in a house surrounded by horse and cow pastures that our cats love to frequent. We had ticks ALL OVER our cats before we began this product. Ticks began showing up in our beds and we found a deer tick on our daughter. Since using Catego, not a single tick on a cat or in the house. This product could truly be a life saver as ticks and Lyme disease are a true danger in our part of the country. I am sincerely relieved to have found an affordable solution to a serious problem.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: This may work better for an indoor cat
customer_reviews.text: Worked the first week, then my cat got fleas again during week two. Flea combed him and got eight fleas off his rump area. They did seem less active and were not moving around much, but definitely alive and wriggling in the rinse water. This may work better for an indoor cat. My cat probably got re-infested outdoors. It doesn't appear strong enough to repel the fleas after week one, just stun them.
customer_reviews.author: SomewhereSouth

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it works; sometimes it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why, but it helps some cats but not others. It also gives chemical burn to some and not others. I prefer Revolution, but of course that's $20 a dose at the vet, and not always convenient. For the price, between Advantage 2 or this, I'm not sure which I'd recommend because we run into the same exact issues with both flea meds. It's worth a try for the cost. I have to add that it's ridiculously hard to get the plastic vessel open to actually get at the spot treatment. I hate getting those things open. Catego, please reconsider the packaging!! I've cut myself a few times!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Did something change about the formulation?
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem with Catego for the last year or two. It worked and didn’t cause irritation to the application site, even in my cat that tends to be extra sensitive and loses fur with all flea meds. I don’t know if something changed but four of my cats had severe hair loss at the application site. These are the cats that never have skin reactions to flea meds, including Catego. I thought perhaps it was a fluke and tried it again the next month and encountered the same issue. I won’t be buying this product anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jess I

customer_reviews.title: Great Product But Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: Had a flea infestation that we had to deal with and this product was a key in stopping in. Pros - applied to cat, and literally watched the fleas drop dead on to the floor. Never saw anything like it before. Cons - like any new product, be aware of how your cats react to it. We had 2 who had poor reactions to it, burning the skin and leaving matchless areas. One we had to give a bath to and get it off he had such a poor reaction. Conclusion - definitely a great product but DO NOT apply and forget the first time. Keep a close eye on your animals and react if they are in distress.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C. Dunmire

customer_reviews.title: Well-Designed and it Works
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a lot of flea medications in my time. And I have to say, this stuff stands out. The applicator is a stroke of genius. It’s obvious that the designer was someone who knew how frustrating these spot-on meds can be. The medication itself WORKS! Starting from a pretty severe infestation, my cats had NO fleas within a day. Still no fleas, coming up on one month. No adverse reactions to the meds, even though one of mine lost all the fur on her neck from a different med. Bottom line is, this stuff is well-designed and works. What more could I ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Mysten

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Product
customer_reviews.text: It may have been a coincidence , but my cat died of an unknown cause 3 days after we applied this topical flea protection, so I can’t give it a fair rating. It was just very strange because the cat was in perfect health before this
customer_reviews.author: ELLEN CATES

customer_reviews.title: Killed these Texas fleas!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. 7 cats, all between 5lbs and 12lbs. One tube per cat, and fleas simply died! Within 2 hours of application, half of the fleas on every cat were dead, the rest barely moving. 24 hours later I got 1 live flea, however the apt was infested...only 3 rooms have carpet and only 1 carpeted cat tree. All bedding had beed washed. Great stuff, killed these Texas fleas! Buying more for back up if the creatures hitch hike on us into the house.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Easy application and great packaging!
customer_reviews.text: This is EXTREMELY easy to use. I am.able tonopen it and apply it to my cats neck in under 30 secs. The packaging is great and allows for such a quick application. I do not like the price just because we could get them at our vets office for over $10 cheaper but since we no longer wish to go to that vet, we had no choice. Still my favorite brand of flea treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Fleas falling off !
customer_reviews.text: these work great ! Fleas n and ticks gone amd I actually seen fleas fall off on my bed later that night ! Shocked its this good for price! One issue I had I thought one tube was empty because nothing came out the 2nd use but 3rd bottle did same thing till I messed w it and seen it was not empty just a small amount so hard to get out . So 4 stars only because injas a little issue with the ease of use .
customer_reviews.author: Hot-Mess Syndrome

customer_reviews.title: Took in a feral boy cat that unfortunately had cat ...
customer_reviews.text: Took in a feral boy cat that unfortunately had cat lice, apparently a rare condition. Indications are that the previous living conditions were filthy. He also has FIV, treated him for fleas and ear yeast. I have three girl cats so he was isolated in the sunroom during treatments. One of the few pet medications that treat cat lice. Weird that my vet never heard of Catego but then again she said cat lice are extremely rare and it’s not normally encountered.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Not working for ticks
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Catego for 16 days on 3 cats. My cats are house cats that I allow out for about an hour a day in the summer. So far I have seen no fleas, but I have taken several ticks off of all 3 cats. I am going to continue using for another month, and then I will leave and updated review.
customer_reviews.author: melissa c

customer_reviews.title: Worked fast. Used on kittens and adult cats.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this as I had never heard of the brand, but I had several kittens and a few adult cats that suddenly broke out with fleas. I thought it was going to be a nightmare to get under control, but this worked very fast and well. It's been a month and I haven't seen any more signs of fleas. Would purchase again. A MUCH better deal than some of the more well known brands like Advantage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Applied one tube to each of my six cats on August 31. Three of them had no sign of fleas. Now they all have fleas, since instead of killing, the product seemed to have repelled them all over the house! I have combed them all twice daily, plus vacuuming, and am still finding live adult and young fleas on all of them. Either this batch was defective, or the product is just junk. For all the warnings that came in the package, you'd think it would kill Godzilla! Total waste of my money, and my time.
customer_reviews.author: nobsratings

customer_reviews.title: As good as PetLock
customer_reviews.text: Price point was great. We usually use Petlock, it's hard to find for cats and quite expensive. This product works just as well for my cat and doesn't break the bank. Also, doesn't leave an oil slick on my cats neck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product works!
customer_reviews.text: People are telling me how their pets are being infested by ticks the past several years. My cat has been receiving this on a monthly basis to prevent flea and tick bite. This item is worth every cent when it comes to my cat's well-being. It's really very easy to apply between their shoulder blades. I apply it to my cat while she's eating. i've not found any fleas or ticks since using this product. My neighbor's cat was in the woods and upon her return home, her owner found several ticks. He was not treating her with anything. The next day he asked me to order what I use on my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, effective.
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice cat owner, someone dropped 2 pregnant bobtails at the end of our lane. What could I do? We became foster parents to those two and their 5 kittens. After visiting the vet once, I was ready to find another source of flea treatment. Low and behold, she had used this same product but charged us 3 times the price here on line! It is working and our cats and us are happy. Once you get the hang of how to use the applicator it is a very recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Neuhart

customer_reviews.title: FLEAS LAUGHED AT THIS
customer_reviews.text: When we moved my 5 cats got fleas. One severely! So I bought Catego because it was a lot cheaper that Advantage or Frontline and had some decent reviews. Unfortunately,it didn't work at all for my cats. My cats are all indoor cats so it isn't like they had to battle lots of fleas all around them all the time. Some reviews say it worked for them,but I definitely didn't have that experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Product!
customer_reviews.text: We have used Revolution on our cats for over ten years and had great success. Recently my vet switched brands and started selling Catego. We bought this and used on all nine of our cats and all nine suffered damage. From burnt hair, lost hair, bald spots, to actual burns on their skin. One was burnt so bad she had to be treated with a steroid and an antibiotic. Needless to say, we will never use this product again nor would we recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst flea med,ever! AVOID AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.text: This product was a complete disappointment! Thee days later, and my cat is still scratching and now it's worse! Maybe an allergic reaction? Now I have to put MORE CHEMICALS on her which I'm not happy about. Back to Advantage which always worked. Don't let the lower price entice you. I didn't see this before or I would NOT have purchased it----PLEASE SEE PICS OF OTHER PEOPLE'S CATS BEING BURNED by this product! Completely unacceptable! WHY IS THIS PRODUCT STILL ON THE MARKET????? P.S. opening up the outer plastic is a joke, and bottle design leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Ophelia

customer_reviews.title: This really worked!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried everything I could I thought until I ordered CATEGO...I have 6 cats & it gets very expensive for me. This actually works for my furbabies...Thanks CATEGO For being honest with your ad...
customer_reviews.author: Gladys Faye Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I had to treat a lot of cats , indoor and outdoor , so I ordered several boxes. I was very excited to use it but highly disappointed with results. Stopped the cats from scratching for a day but really did not kill fleas. I gave 2 applications to my neighbor and she said did not kill fleas on her 2 indoor cats. Will have to go back to using Cheristen. And not a fan of special applicator either. Took me longer to take tubes out of special packaging then to treat cats.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri M.

customer_reviews.title: Foaming at the mouth
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 6 months old and weighs 4.5 lbs. Within 5 min of applying it, she was foaming at the mouth. I used a dry shampoo to remove it immediately. I'm returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: D Zimmy

customer_reviews.title: Flea Be Gone
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase. I HIGHLY recommend it. I have four cats and the battle against pesky fleas is very real at my house. My poor fur babies have been so miserable. This product worked so quickly to eliminate the flea problem. It was within a day I noticed the difference and could not find fleas on the cats. When something finally works you stick with it.
customer_reviews.author: jmr3268

customer_reviews.title: NO GOOD - save yourself some money
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself some money and just put some droplets of water on your cats neck. It will be just as ineffective. It seems that these Fipronil knock-offs are completely ineffective. They used to make my cats mad at their smell and would kill fleas and ticks within hours. Now, the cats act as though I'm just putting water drops on their back. No smell, no negative reaction to the drops - and no relief from fleas. Save your money and move along.
customer_reviews.author: The Tech

customer_reviews.title: Does not help with ticks at all
customer_reviews.text: Used this last year and still had to pull a couple ticks off my kitty boy. Again this year I have already pulled two ticks of of the cat, one tick off my son’s head and found another tick on my other son’s comforter because the cat sleeps on their beds all the time. We have no fleas but it clearly does not help with ticks at all. Going to fork out more money for a product that will hopefully work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfBoys

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 1/2 weeks.....
customer_reviews.text: I read all the positive reviews on this product. The product works, but not for the full month. I applied it on the 17th of July. It is Aug 1st and the product has stopped working. Sorry guys! This product does not continue working for the full month as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Miss_Nikkie

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a safe, effective, and inexpensive flea treatment as I have a lot of inside cats as well as a semi feral colony outside that comes to the porch to eat. Needless to say, fleas can be a BIG issue for us. Also 3 of our cats have flea allergies, so we want to keep fleas to a minimum. This stuff does the trick without breaking the bank!
customer_reviews.author: mommabear

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I’ve bought this product from you. I was purchasing this through the vet prior but it was definitely cheaper on here. I didn’t really have an issue the first round I noticed my cats scratching a bit more but didn’t see any fleas but with this second purchase my cats ended up getting fleas! I have 6 cats so I may be a little frustrated. I’m not sure what changed in the product or if it’s truly just not the same my vets office carries. Super frustrated but I was hoping to be able to save money through you guys.
customer_reviews.author: Camille Sottovento

customer_reviews.title: Worst Cat Flea & Tick Treatment !
customer_reviews.text: This is a total waste of your money. I applied following instructions, FYI, I've been using spot on type of Flea & Tick treatment for over 20 years. This is the first time i've bought this Brand and it's totally worthless. I applied to my cats a week ago and both of my cats are covered in fleas. They have more fleas now than before I applied the product. This brand Does Not Work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Gal

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: We used Catego on our cat for approximately years. Seemed to work great for quite a while until recently. We've picked big, engorged, ticks off of him for the past 3 days. Not sure if the Catego has lost it's effectiveness or if the lil buggers are developing an immunity? Either way we'll be seeking an alternative solution.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite flea and tick control. My cat, for some odd reason, gets ear mites. I tried the stuff the vet gives me for her ears but is horrible and she usually ends up hating me more than it helps her. O put this on her and in a few days her ear mites are gone. It also doesn't leave her fur greasy nor smelly. It smeels when you first apply but once it dries out it's good. It does crust up a bit but I usually brush my data fur to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Does a very good job
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it does not smell as horrid as all of the others we have tried. The kitties don't lose their hair in that spot either. Easy to apply, cat's don't like it, but they wouldn't like any liquid poured on their neck unexpectedly! Overall I would say it does a good job, but I wish it would last a little bit longer. We are seeing fleas about 3 - 3.5 weeks into the monthly application. If they could find a way to extend that a bit it would be a GREAT product!!
customer_reviews.author: Etiz

customer_reviews.title: Won't kill all the fleas after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked this product because it immediately reduced the amount of fleas on my cats however after 3 monthly treatments they still aren't gone. I did this in conjunction with spraying my house for fleas and daily flea combing. My cats still have fleas just less of them. To make matters worse the price of this product has gone up by almost $10. It definitely isn't worth the money now. Try something else because this will only decrease your flea problem, not end it.
customer_reviews.author: Janette Raven

customer_reviews.title: Amazing flea and tick protection!
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought Catego at a local pet-supply store on an employee's recommendation. They no longer carried the product, so I turned to Amazon. Catego is fantastic. I have two indoor/outdoor cats. In years past we were overrun with disgusting, biting fleas during the summer months. But thanks to the regular application of Catego, we are completely flea-free! It is easily applied, does not seem to irritate my cats, and is reasonably priced in comparison to similar products. Try Catego. You have nothing to lose but fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H.

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR REPEATED USE / USE FOR CATS WITH SENSITIVE SKIN
customer_reviews.text: After about a year of use, product makes my cats extremely uncomfortable, and cry and flinch in pain when applied. My youngest cat now has a large bald patch on the back of her neck where product was applied. I care for my cats very much, and I felt it was important to change my 5 star review to a 1 star because of the physical pain this medicine caused my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: My cat had serious side effects from this product
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my 15 week old kitten and she immediately started foaming at the mouth. I washed it off her but she still got sick to her stomach. I didn't realize how strong this medicine was based on package description. I feel there should be a warning label telling about side effects. I will never use this product again and will not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: My cat is 100% indoors and my place is also pretty chilly at all times
customer_reviews.text: I will speak behalf on that this product did not do any damage on the skin or fur when I started applying to my 10 week old ragdoll. It seemed to be the only safe option for a young kitten that wasn't Frontline (that also cover fleas AND ticks) and I did plan on using something else when she got older. Sure, it's effective for me so far. Keep in mind, I live in a second floor apartment in an urban suburban area. My cat is 100% indoors and my place is also pretty chilly at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Catego box was EMPTY!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product a few months ago and never opened it. I was still using my Frontline. Today my vet saw a flea on my cat, in mid winter! so I opened the catego when I got home. Guess what? Each plastic holder was EMPTY. APPARENTLY the order was tempered with or screwed up when it was packaged. Either way, I’m totally out the money I spent because I waited too long. I will always check my orders from Amazon on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: marianne

customer_reviews.title: Evaporates quickly upon opening so get the cat's hair parted and ready for application before popping the seal.
customer_reviews.text: Told my vet that Frontline stopped working on our cat. She said it has become less effective over time due to resistant strains. She recommended Catego because I needed a product that treated both fleas and ticks. Seems to work well. The few ticks I've seen on my cat this season have been dead and have seen no fleas on her or in the house. I think the price is a little lower than Frontline was also. Previously tried a generic version of Frontline and made my cat sick. Must apply to skin, so part the hair out of the way and apply to upper back of neck where they can't lick it off.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha

customer_reviews.title: Huge price increase makes Catego less than attractive
customer_reviews.text: This spot on flea solution worked about as well as Advantage II. I still saw some scratching afterwards so it did not kill all the fleas but it did help. Applied to 6 cats and none had any allergic reaction or fur loss at the site of application. Unfortunately the price has gone up by $20 on the exact same product since I ordered it less than 2 months ago so I won't be purchasing more. At this price I may as well stay with Advantage II, which has worked just as well and is much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Noxia

customer_reviews.title: Do Not use on kittens!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my kitten, 13 weeks old, bought it specifically because it says ok for kittens over 8 weeks and 1.5 lbs. After applying as instructed, my kitten started foaming at the mouth! I immediately washed off the treatment and then bathed her a second time, she was trembling for awhile, I called the 800 number on the box, no answer. She seems ok now, but it was very scary, I would never put this on a kitten, wish I would have read All of the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Catego Flea and Tick Control for Cats
customer_reviews.text: Catego Flea and Tick Control for Cats works well on normal sized cats. I have some cats that are 15 plus pounds as they are big males. Catego works quite well, but I still find a few fleas down near their tails. It is as if I need a larger amount to cover these big cats. It works great on my other cats. I have never found a tick on any of them with Catego.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Use With Caution
customer_reviews.text: Please use this with caution! Two of my three cats had a reaction to this product. It completely burned the hair off from the application site and burned their skin.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Worked, but burned 1 of the 5 cats
customer_reviews.text: Fleas are gone, but it did irritate one of my cats neck. I have 5 cats, and 4 did fine but one ended up with a slight burn and hair loss at the application spot (see pic of small spot on shoulder blade area). It got completely better after a couple of weeks. I can only assume different cats have different skin and some may be irritated by various products, so I don't really blame the product since the other 4 cats had no adverse reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney S.

customer_reviews.title: Wish it did work because I love the applicator
customer_reviews.text: Have administered twice. Not working. Going to have to go back to the Cheristin at 16.00 a dose from the Vet. Pet Armor or Advantage not working anymore either! Wish it did work because I love the applicator!
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Bald spots on cat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product due to the applicator, which does make the product easier to apply. Unfortunately, I didn't find it any more effective than other treatments I've tried. Even worse, a bald spot appeared at the application site days later. I don't wish to harm my cat and will not ever use this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I liked the one hand squueze to release medication. No scissors needed. longer neck made it easier to apply on long haired cats. Did not seem to upset the cats when applied like other brands have.
customer_reviews.author: shelly jackson

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because I’ve never heard of this brand but had small kittens who needed it. Within an hour I was watching the fleas die off. The kittens went crazy while it was happening tho, I assume the fleas were biting them like crazy. They were happy after the fleas were gone but I wish it lasted longer then a week.
customer_reviews.author: Cori R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work that well
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a couple of months as directed, it reduced the number of fleas, but didn't get rid of them. Also the packaging is a hand slicing nightmare that requires heavy duty scissors to open and creates massive amounts of unnecessary plastic waste that will end up in land fills or oceans.
customer_reviews.author: Obnubilated

customer_reviews.title: Works very quickly, but only lasts for a couple days
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed with how fast this worked on my 2 kittens, not a single flea for several days. After about 5 days they were covered in fleas again so not sure that the "prevents re-infestation" actually works. I’ll also add that these our outside cats, we sprayed our yard, change and wash their bedding every day, and brush them 3x per day so don’t think it’s a lack of getting the environment under control although that could be a part of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: So-so product
customer_reviews.text: Works ok if you first use Capstar to rid of live fleas. Took the hair of several of my cats necks, but others it did not affect. We still had fleas after a week, but if you use Capstar first, it's not too bad. I would recommend using more often than once a month if you have a bad infestation. We did end up switching to another product that works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this product for over two years now and my cats are indoor outdoor and flea and tick free in rural country area. Sure could be cheaper but it works. Cats sometimes get jittery on application because I believe it's causing hell to fleas that may happen to be on your cat.
customer_reviews.author: emszach

customer_reviews.title: House of many cats~
customer_reviews.text: I got this via a recommendation from thcatlvt she a great cat advocate. Works great! My cats flea meds I was using before for years wasn’t working as efficiently as before. Now this stuff works great!!! It killed the fleas and more (I swear my cats have super powers now!) I highly recommend this!!! Easy to use and works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Robison

customer_reviews.title: Catego A Must
customer_reviews.text: I got this 2 weeks ago for a 3 cat flea infestation. Product starts killing fleas at the 6th hr as Promised but won’t completely kill the infestation for a good 24 hours. My suggestion is to isolate the animal or animals after application so you don’t have fleas bouncing all over your house and getting on you and your family. One of my cats is hypersensitive to these pesticides but showed no reaction to this one. I gladly give this review 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work. Our indoor cats somehow got fleas, and despite using this product according to instruction - which claims to kill adult, larva and eggs - we are still having issues 2 weeks later. I now have to wait another two weeks (how many more fleas will be born and re-infest our cats in that time?! So gross.) before it’s safe for me to re-apply another round of any treatment. Definitely going to order the more expensive vet-recommended stuff next time. I learned my lesson not to try to save a few bucks, and to just buy the good stuff the first time. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: C. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work, my cat goes outdoors a lot and haven't seen ticks. Product didn't burn his skin or cause bald spot like other reviews said. He did throw up once or twice a day or two after application and then he's fine but he seems to do that with most flea and tick products I've used. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JLO

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Burns/Sickness/Fatality
customer_reviews.text: STAY AWAY!! Tried this product out after reading reviews. Like many of the other critical reviews, our cat received chemical burns and became extremely ill. Unfortunately he passed away 4 days after I administered the medication. Not sure if it was from that or something else but either way DON’T chance it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried as alternative to bayer small cat
customer_reviews.text: As it is almost always flea /tick season in NY, I got this as a preventive for my indoor cat who occasionally sneaks outside. She has had some itching lately but no obvious infestation. Hoping this clears any minor bugs. The applicator is fantastic. On the day of application my cat showed mild agitation and so I deducted a star. Like the price on amazon of 17 for 3 but now I see the price is almost 3 times that which is not a bargain at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ava K Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Wiped out the fleas on my nine cats in a day. Very easy to open and apply. My usually treatment-resistant cats didn’t even know I put it on them. No squalling, writhing, scratching, or biting. No vanishing under the bed, no skulking, no outraged looks. I love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Same product for a better price than the vet charged.
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended this product for our cat that was allergic to his flea and tick collar. The product seems to work well but the price on Amazon is much better that the price from the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Boston

customer_reviews.title: I also really like the built in applicator
customer_reviews.text: Catego works! Have not seen a flea on my cat. My cat have not responded well to other flea meds but have not had a problem with Catego. I also really like the built in applicator.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Highly affective, works within days of application
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing!!! My cat was going bald and had scabs from a flea infestation, he was highly allergic.I used this stuff and within days he was growing hair back and is doing so much better. I highly recommend this flea treatment to anyone with pets.
customer_reviews.author: Britney Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Was a little bit skeptic before purchasing the product but I decided to give it a shot. I bought it for a stray kitten I brought in with fleas and as prevention for my two other cats. I had a bit of a difficult time with the application cat but was able to apply most of the product successfully. Next day no fleas in sight and no side effects.
customer_reviews.author: mairim

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on Fl fleas
customer_reviews.text: I live in Fl. There seems to be no flea medications that work on fleas here. Only Revolution, which is prescription only. Aside from that my cats had no allergic reaction. They did not suffer illness or bald patches. They are 7 and 9lbs. I just wish it worked here on Florida fleas. (Edit: Revolution has stopped working. I will be trying a new vet recommend medication for my cats soon)
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Young kittens safety and Price.
customer_reviews.text: I chose your product for two reasons. 1. It could be used on kittens. 😊 2. If it works as well as promoted the price is Glorious. The kitten 😺 is a rescue out here in the country. So yes bless her heart. I could see the fleas (not major infestation) crawling through white fur. We just "dosed" All 3 cats on the 13th of July. I can't speak to the "6 hour" description. BUT... I Haven't seen any on Iota (little baby) and my other two appear to be Scratch free as well. So YES. I would Most DEFINITELY Recommend to anyone... Especially those who have young kittens.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby_K

customer_reviews.title: Product Made Our Cat Very Sick
customer_reviews.text: Our six year old male cat has had flea meds used on him all his life and never had an adverse reaction. He had a bad reaction to Catego and everything he'd eaten came up. Poor boy was a sick little fellow until he got it all out of his system. I would not recommend this product. It was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: N. Leffingwelli

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever to totally eliminate fleas!
customer_reviews.text: I have five cats. I have used various products for several years in the battle of the fleas. I finally searched the Internet in desperation to give my cats - and my house - relief from this terrible invasion. Buying Catego not only gave immediate relief - it has totally eliminated the problem from cats and Home! Relief at long last. My cats are no longer tormented or scratching! They are itch free, happy and content. This product is the best ever- total blessing 😁😁
customer_reviews.author: Ellie - Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: A small (about 8-10 week old) kitten showed up at our barn covered in fleas. She was sweet as she could be though so we decided to keep her. Used this product and the next day the fleas were gone. It's been almost a month and I check her every day (she loves to roll over and have her tummy scratched) and still, no fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Tyanne

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working for fleas and ticks but the cat is still biting and scratching himself and we're coming up with bites of some kind ourselves so there must be something else out there that this does not work on so well. And it is chigger season so that's my suspect. Don't recall this issue with previous brands.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: It is working
customer_reviews.text: I am having to cut expenses lately, and can no longer afford Frontline, but I needed something that keeps the fleas off, some don't. I decided to take a chance on this brand and I haven't seen my cats scratch once.
customer_reviews.author: Granny

customer_reviews.title: Effective on ticks but can burn fur or skin
customer_reviews.text: Catego worked well at killing some ticks that were on my cat. The ticks fell off within 24 hours. Catego did not make the cat ill, but it did create a bald spot where the product was applied. I would possibly buy Catego again, but would shop around first as this product seems fairly caustic, and is somewhat pricey. I would probably not use this on a cat that was very young, old or sick. When using for the first time I would closely monitor the cat and the area of application for a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: Jimi Dee

customer_reviews.title: Fleas not phased
customer_reviews.text: After having our precious indoor/outdoor master hunter cat for over seven years we have tired multiple flea medications to prevent immunities. This by far has been the least effective. After the first use and repeated combing and vacuuming the fleas did at least to appear lathargic for the first 3 days. Within a week our cat's fleas were back to full strength and in mass number. After 30 days we retreated out cat and this time it was ineffective as two days after our cat's fleas have not been phased. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: If you want your cat to nearly die from a flea treatment, try this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Should not even be on the market. Our cat nearly died and honestly, we are shocked he's still with us - it was horrifying. Company seemed to not care at all and never followed up with me. Enough said. Get Capstar instead - worked great and he was not ill.
customer_reviews.author: Petra L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for multi-cat / multi-weight household
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this brand because I have 5 cats and four of them are about the same weight (14 lbs) which makes buying one box of flea treatment easy but there is an outlier in the group. She weighs 4.5 lbs and is fully grown (13 y/o). This brand makes it easier to buy one six-pack box and it works for 1.5 lbs and higher.
customer_reviews.author: MsCarbonated

customer_reviews.title: Worked without side effects!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous after some of the scary reviews for these types of flea meds, but it worked great on my tiniest kitten who is just 2 lbs. Even with me watching him he immediately licked it and I had to rinse his mouth. Next morning, zero fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Letha Hansen

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical at first, now I'm so happy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a single dose from my vet for almost the same price as this 3 pack. I was skeptical at first b/c my kittens are only 10 weeks old but it seems to be working [going on month #2 with this brand]. Super easy to open and apply with on hand while you hold your cat down lol (my cats are too smart for their own good)
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hook

customer_reviews.title: Won't repurchase
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I was hoping this would be an effective option for flea control, but am sorry to say that I would definitely not purchase again. If it had any effect on fleas on our 3 cats, it wasn't much, or for long -- nothing compared to Revolution for cats, and not as good as Advantage or Frontline either. Furthermore, while it didn't upset our short haired tabby or our tortie, it made our long haired tuxedo fellow pretty sick, with vomiting the day it was applied and throughout the next day. He's young and otherwise healthy...and is still mad at me, I think! Not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: An Islander

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to help for the first few days however within a week and a half the fleas were back in full force. Now I can't do anything for my poor cats until this wears off. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product did not work well on my cat. It seemed to take effect for the first few days but within a week I was finding flea eggs again. Although it was less expensive than the major brands I feel it was just a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: At one time I was using other popular flea prevention products but something changed a few years ago and they were no longer effective. I asked my Vet about this and she recommended Catego. It works great and I'm so happy to know there is a product on the market that actually works and doesn't cost an arm and a leg.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W Lombardi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use applicator, non-oily treatment with a pleasant scent that is quickly absorbed. One of my cats has a severe flea allergy and I started using this on her a few months ago. Her fur is now full and soft and she's gained weight. Very happy with this product. I will definitely be a repeat buyer.
customer_reviews.author: P. MacLearn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product!
customer_reviews.text: The day I put this on my three kittens, they were miserable. They were biting and scratching terribly. I don’t know if it made the fleas more aggressive or if it was the product aggravating their skin. I’m sorry I wasted my money and put my kittens through this. A week later, they still have just as many fleas.
customer_reviews.author: LibraryGirl

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: It did not kill all of the fleas on my cats. I cancelled the second order due to continued finding of live fleas on my cats almost a month after application. They are indoor cats (yes I realize I can bring fleas in to them - but my yard has been treated). Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Pekarek

customer_reviews.title: Good price, no bad reaction for us
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this on an outside stray cat and haven't had any problems with it over the last year. She's never had any burns or bad reactions. I'm giving 4 stars because I can't testify to how well it actually works as she lives outside and still scratches from time to time. But the price is good and I have peace of mind that she's not going nuts with fleas.
customer_reviews.author: LittleBob

customer_reviews.title: "Super Fleas" Resistant to Catego now?
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my vet but it doesn't seem to be working as well as I was told it would. Might switch to revolution. My cat has a flea allergy and she got the steroid shot which seemed to calm her down. After two months of Catego, it doesn't seem any more effective than the vet-declared ineffective Advantage II and she's back to pre-steroid over-grooming.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Diane

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research, I ordered this because it's supposed to be effective on ticks as well as fleas. So, I applied about 3 weeks ago and while I haven't seen more of either, I certainly haven't seen less either. As far as I can tell, I may as well have just applied water, it would've been about as effective.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Becky

customer_reviews.title: SEEMS TO WORK-RECOMMENDED BY MY VET
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a feral cat I trapped and fixed, but he was full of fleas so I used this on him, and three of my other cats. It seems to work, good price, but one cat now has a bald area with a scab where I put the medication. This happened with frontline also, so it could be that some cats are just sensitive to flea products. I would definitely recommend trying this, and my vet recommends it.
customer_reviews.author: ouimcm

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, & no complaints from the cat!
customer_reviews.text: Had to find an alternative to Frontline, which had stopped working on fleas. But not before my poor cat (and house) was infested. Saw a flyer at the vets for Catego. Have applied it twice and it seems to work very well. No side effects yet.
customer_reviews.author: Judy K.

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found for my cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, and one has a flea allergy. She will get scabs and lose her fur from scratching after one bite. The pills work best on her, but she isn't keen on the pills. I decided to give this a try. It's the only flea drop that works on her. My vet said he is seeing drop resistant fleas in the area, but this works. I've ordered the 6 pack twice for them. I use Frontline on my dogs, but it doesn't last as long as this. I just wish they had a formula for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Cari D.

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to treat our cats for fleas on the recommendation from a local spay and neuter program. After using it we noticed a slight decrease in fleas but nothing significant. All the cats still have fleas. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product will continue to use
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats, and treat on all 3 at the same time. They do tend to get a little lethargic within about 30 minutes of application and it usually lasts about an hour. None of them have had any serious reactions though. And the product works very well. Overall I am extremely satisfied with this product and will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Siamese Twins are No Longer scratching
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time I had bought this product and so far I'm very Happy with it. My twin Siamese Girl's are no longer scratching which is a plus for me as they stay in the house 24/7 365 Day's a Year. Will Be buying again, Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: The best flea medication for cats!
customer_reviews.text: Best flea medication for cats hands down! It works very quickly, flea die off & are completely gone in hours! It soaks in quickly & you apply it in an area the cat cant reach so they cant lick it & harm themselves! If you have MORE THAN ONE CAT they need to be separated till it dries so they dont lick it off eachother.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Nell

product_meta.title: Catego Fast-Acting Flea & Tick Treatment For Cats/Kittens (Over 1.5 lbs), Kills Fleas Within 6 Hours, Prevents Flea Re-Infestations
product_meta.description: Size:3 packIntroducing Catego a flea and tick product made especially for cats. Catego kills fleas in 6 hours while Frontline Plus and Advantage II kills fleas in 12 hours. Catego works to address your cat’s needs by killing fleas, flea eggs, flea larvae, ticks and chewing lice. Catego works for a full month and fleas do not need to bite your cat for our product to work. In addition, our product has patented applicator making it easy to administer and effectively get under your cat’s coat to the skin. Catego works for cats over 1.5 lbs and 8 weeks of age and is available in 3 packs and 6 packs.
feature_bullets: FOR CATS OVER 1.5 LBS: Catego is a safe and effective formula for cats that kills fleas, flea eggs, flea larvae, ticks and chewing lice. May be used on cats as young as 8 weeks old
FAST RELIEF: Catego kills fleas in just 6 hours compared to other brands that take 12 hours
LONG LASTING MEDICINE: Your cat will be rid of those unwanted guests for 30 days
ACTIVE INGREDIENTS: Catego has a unique combination of three proven active ingredients; Dinotefuran, Fipronil, and Pyriproxyfen
EASY TO APPLY: The patented applicator makes it easy to apply and minimizes risk of skin abrasion. The formula is non greasy, quick drying, and is small in volume; ensuring no medicine is wasted

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
